p: Moreover, cardioprotective and antihypertensive properties were attributed to different Bryophyllum sp. [ 68]. For instance, the aqueous extracts of B. pinnatum have been shown to exhibit in vivo antihypertensive activity on high salt-loaded rats models [ 69]. Furthermore, isolates from B. daigremontianum root extracts developed an in vitro anti-thrombotic activity [ 70].
